@Maib121 

With just under 2% of your portfolio and in equity, not having to worry about expiration time, I probably wouldn't make any changes. They're still cheaper than Microsoft but with much greater forward growth.

$ETSY 5Y Forward Growth: 38.95%
$MSFT 5Y Forward Growth:  17.40%

As I pointed out earlier, Etsy is cheaper by most multiples -- earnings, sales, free cash flow, etc. If anything you may want to pick up short term puts to hedge against any major declines fueled by the overall market.

@CROSTAKE 

Unless your position is to avoid any and all long positions, no matter what company, then I don't see the relevance to Etsy. 

Though I do agree with you that the market will experience a decline similar to Dot-Com Bubble 1.0, well valued companies won't be hit as hard or take as long to recover.

Seeing $QQQ up 3% the day following Russia's invasion of Ukraine shows just how difficult it is to time these things. However, many catalysts are in place to pop the bubble.

@Why_Trade not really a worthless opinion. With cyber in more demand and only growing, a buyout at $30-35 is a joke. $40-50 range . Yes that sounds like a fairly large premium but if $MSFT or whoever wants them screws around and Mandiant earnings get better and better while cyber attack risk moves higher and higher they will pay even more ..

I posted a value comparison of the 4 companies above (linked below) to show just how monstrously overvalued DataDog and Snowflake are, using Microsoft as a blue chip FAANG benchmark.

Etsy was already cheaper than Microsoft, after earnings it looks even better.

As of close using 21Q4 adjusted numbers...

P/E: 27.5x (Previously 35x)
P/S: 6.8x (Previously 8x)

Microsoft is at 31.6x earnings and 11.8x sales respectively.
